newsitem.title: USA: Doncasters surges after IPO debut.
newsitem.headline: Doncasters surges after IPO debut.

text.p: Doncasters Plc shares jumped 21 percent in heavy early trading on Thursday as the company went public after its spin-off by Canadian mining company Inco Ltd.
American Depositary Shares (ADSs) jumped 3-3/8 to 19-7/8 in very heavy trading with Doncasters the second most active issue on the New York Stock Exchange.
Eight million ADSs were offered by Inco in the initial public offering for $16.50 each, the top of its estimated pricing range of $13.50 to $16.50. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares.
Inco will receive all of the proceeds of about $132 million from the IPO, it said.
Doncasters makes engineered components for tolerance- critical applications, mostly in the aerospace and industrial gas and steam turbine industries.
It also makes precision-engineered parts, subassemblies and modules to customer specifications in a range of specialty metals and alloys.
Credit Suisse First Boston and Schroder Wertheim & Co are underwriters of the offering. The company has granted them an option to buy up to an additional 800,000 ADSs to cover over-allotments.

Doncasters will only receive proceeds if the over-allotment option is exercised. It said it will use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, which may include acquisitions of complementary businesses.
Derbyshire, England-based Doncasters representatives rang the opening bell to signal the start of trading at the NYSE this morning.
